refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the next field in the result set

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The maxdb_fetch_field returns the definition of one column of a result set as an resource. Call this function repeatedly to retrieve information about all columns in the result set. maxdb_fetch_field returns &false; when no more fields are left.

refsect1.title: Return values
refsect1.para: Returns a resource which contains field definition information or &false; if no field information is available.

row.entry: The maximum width of the field for the result set.
The data type used for this field
The number of decimals used (for integer fields)

refsect1.title: Example

example.title: Procedural style
example.programlisting:
<?php
$link = maxdb_connect("localhost", "MONA", "RED");

/* check connection */
if (maxdb_connect_errno()) {
   printf("Connect failed: %s\n", maxdb_connect_error());
   exit();
}

$query = "SELECT name, cno from hotel.customer ORDER BY cno";

if ($result = maxdb_query($link, $query)) {

   /* Get field information for all fields */
   while ($finfo = maxdb_fetch_field($result)) {
 
       printf("Name:     %s\n", $finfo->name);
       printf("Table:    %s\n", $finfo->table);
       printf("max. Len: %d\n", $finfo->max_length);
       printf("Flags:    %d\n", $finfo->flags);
       printf("Type:     %d\n\n", $finfo->type);
   }
   maxdb_free_result($result);
}

/* close connection */
maxdb_close($link);
?>

refsect1.para: The above examples would produce the following output:
refsect1.screen:
Name: NAME Table: max. Len: 10 Flags: -1 Type: 2
Name: CNO Table: max. Len: 4 Flags: -1 Type: 0
